list_definition.definition: in chess, a position from which the king cannot escape

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She made her move and declared ‘checkmate’.

list_definition.definition: to put (an opponent’s king) in this position

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Within just a few moves he had checkmated his opponent’s king.

list_ex_of_english: Due to the multi-player nature of the game, there is no checkmate and kings can be captured.
Checkmate can be forced without strictly using either of the methods.
Rg7 and checkmate on g8 next move, else loss of rook since the bishop covers f3.: 9.
There are no rules for check or checkmate; however, in practice a player resigns when checkmated.
He has been led on as though he was playing a game of chess to a checkmate.
A bare king can never give check, however, and can therefore never deliver a checkmate.
In some descriptions of the game, the winner is the first player to checkmate twice, or to checkmate a player who has already checkmated another.
Four dabbabas (each covering a different quarter of the chessboard) and a king can easily force checkmate on a bare king.
